Bash(git commit -m "feat: comprehensive error logging improvements

Enhance error handling and logging throughout the client to provide maximum
debugging information when API errors occur.

**1. Validation Error Details (utils.py)**
When 422 validation errors occur, exception messages now include detailed
validation errors with field paths:

Before:
  ValidationError: Invalid request data

After:
  ValidationError: Invalid request data
  Validation errors:
    - Expected number, received string (path: body.default_supplier_id)
    - String must contain at least 1 character(s) (path: body.name)

**2. Additional Error Context (utils.py)**
All error responses now include additional_properties for extra debugging
context like request IDs, timestamps, etc:

  BadRequest: Invalid parameters
  Additional context:
    request_id: abc123
    timestamp: 2024-01-01T12:00:00Z

**3. Error Parsing Diagnostics (katana_client.py)**
When error response parsing fails, log debug messages to help identify when
the API returns unexpected formats:

  DEBUG: Failed to parse as DetailedErrorResponse: TypeError: ...

This addresses production issues where errors said ''See error object details
for more info'' but didn''t show the details. Now all available error
information is automatically included in logs and exceptions.

Changes:
- Enhanced unwrap() to format validation details and additional properties
- Added debug logging for error parsing failures in ResilientAsyncTransport
- Added 2 new comprehensive tests for error message formatting
- All 60 unit tests passing (33 utils, 27 katana_client)
